hesr 1.1.2

Read the Scottish Hospital Episode Statistics data files

read_hes_scot.Rd

Reads in Hospital Episode Statistics for Scotland data files for each year from 2007/08 to 2021/22. The data were provided with only the variables and disease codes needed for computing the rates of diseases related to tobacco and/or alcohol and the associated rates and costs of hospital admissions.

read_hes_scot(k.year.ind)

Arguments

k.year.ind

Integer - the year of Scottish HES data. In the format "2022".

Value

Returns a data table. Note that:

  • All variable names are converted to lower case.

Details

This code reads in the data for one year and produces a cleaned data file ready for further analysis.

Variables included

  • PATIENT_ID

  • AGE_IN_YEARS

  • SEX - 1 = male, 2 = female. 0 or 9 are not known and not specified.

  • ADMIDATE

  • ADMISSION_TYPE - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=A&ID=58&Title=Admission

  • ADMISSION_TRANSFER_FROM- `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=A&ID=59&Title=Admission/Transfer

  • DISDATE

  • DISCHARGE_TRANSFER_TO - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=D&ID=228&Title=Discharge/Transfer

  • DISCHARGE_TYPE - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=D&ID=224&Title=Discharge

  • SPELBGIN - 0 = Not first episode of spell; 1 = First episode of spell that started in previous year; 2 = First episode of spell that started in current year

  • DISCHARGE_DATE

  • ADMISSION_DATE

  • SPELDUR - the difference in days between the admission date (admidate) and the discharge date (epiend) provided the discharge method (dismeth) confirms that the spell has finished. If the episode has not finished it is calculated from the end of the year and admidate.

  • SPELEND - whether the episode is the last of a spell. It is set for finished episodes (episode status - epistat - is 3) for general, delivery or birth episodes (episode type - epitype - is 1, 2 or 3) provided the discharge method (dismeth) confirms that the spell has finished. Y = Last episode of spell ; N = Not last episode of spell

  • LENGTH_OF_STAY - The patients length of stay derived from admission date and discharge date.

  • EPISODE_MARKER - indicating the order of episodes of care

  • GLS_CIS_MARKER - SMR01 Continuous Inpatient Stay Marker (including GLS records)

  • MAIN_CONDITION - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Data-Dictionary/SMR-Datasets/General-Clinical-Information/Diagnostic-Section/Main-Condition.asp`

  • OTHER_CONDITION_1 - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=O&ID=365&Title=Other

  • OTHER_CONDITION_2

  • OTHER_CONDITION_3

  • OTHER_CONDITION_4

  • OTHER_CONDITION_5

  • ADMISSION_REASON - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Data-Dictionary/SMR-Datasets/Episode-Management/Admission-Reason/`

  • MAIN_OPERATION - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=M&ID=316&Title=Main

  • OTHER_OPERATION_1 - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=O&ID=368&Title=Other

  • OTHER_OPERATION_2

  • OTHER_OPERATION_3

  • MANAGEMENT_OF_PATIENT - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=O&ID=368&Title=Other

  • SPECIALTY - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=S&ID=473&Title=Specialty/Discipline`

  • HRG42 - Healthcare Resource Group (HRG) codes are standard groupings of clinically similar treatments which use comparable levels of healthcare resource. The field contains version 4 HRG codes.

  • PROVIDER_CODE - `https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Dictionary-A-Z/Definitions/index.asp?Search=P&ID=932&Title=Provider

  • simd2016_sc_quintile - Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation quintile of patient residence (2016 version). Least deprived = 5, most deprived = 1

  • EPISODE_RECORD_KEY - sequential number generated by PAS identifying the episode

Examples


if (FALSE) {

hes_2002 <- read_hes("0203", test = TRUE)

}
